sessions.title: Session 1 — Split Step Fundamentals
sessions.summary: Introductory session focused on building a strong split step foundation. Covered proper athletic posture, explosive push-off mechanics, and directional recovery patterns. No video recordings for this session.

drills.name: Ready Position & Resistance Band Work
drills.description: Half-squat athletic stance with resistance band lateral, forward, and backward movement patterns.
drills.notes: Stay on the balls of your feet — keep the band tension throughout

drills.name: Split Step Reaction — Drop & Catch
drills.description: Shuttle dropped from height; execute a split step and catch it before it lands.
drills.notes: Focus on timing the split step, not just catching the shuttle

drills.name: Bench Drop into Split Step
drills.description: Step off a low bench, land with a split step, then push off in a given direction.
drills.notes: The drop exaggerates the loading phase — feel the rhythm before adding speed

drills.name: Directional Recovery
drills.description: Shuttle thrown to mid-court; split step, read direction, recover, then move to the net.
drills.notes: Lead with the correct foot based on the direction you need to move

tips.text: The split step is not a jump — it's a quick, controlled drop that loads energy for an explosive push-off
Initiate your split step just before your opponent makes contact with the shuttle
Always return to the ready position with a split step after every shot
Land with one foot slightly ahead of the other to create a directional advantage
